original: Bengtsson, Ragnar Ludwig, provinsialläkare, Eringsboda, f. 4/3/02 i Örby, Älvsb. 1., av godsäg. Carl B. o. Ida Svensson. G. 34 m. Vanja Friberg. Barn: Bengt Ake f. 35, Per Håkan 42. — Stud:ex. i Borås 21, med. kand. 24 o. med. hc. 29 i Sthlm. Tf. prov:läk. i Tjörns distr. 29, i Övertorneå distr. 29-30, assist :läk. o. tf. andre undiläk. v. Borås las. kirurg, o. med. avd. 31-32, tf. andre und :läk. v. Vänersborgs las. kirurg, avd. 32-33, andre und :läk. där 33-36, tf. prov :läk. i Tierps distr. 36-37, e. läk. i Öjebyns distr. 37, undiläk. v. Spenshults sanat. 37-38, tf. provrläk. i Nybro o. Söderköp. distr. kortare tider 38, e. läk. resp. tf. undiläk. v. Sthlms epid :sjukh. 38-39, _e. läk. v. S :t Sigfrids isjukh. i Växjö 40, proviläk. i Eringsboda distr. sed. 41.
translated: Bengtsson, Ragnar Ludwig was a district physician in Eringsboda. He was born on March 4, 1902 in Örby, Älvsborgs län, the son of the estate owner Carl B. and Ida Svensson. He was married in 1934 to Vanja Friberg and they had two children: Bengt Ake, born in 1935, and Per Håkan, born in 1942. He obtained his high school diploma in Borås in 1921, his bachelor’s degree in medicine in 1924 and his doctorate in medicine in 1929, both from Stockholm University. He was acting district physician in Tjörn’s district in 1929, in Övertorneå’s district in 1929-1930, assistant physician and acting second assistant physician at the surgical and medical departments of Borås hospital in 1931-1932, acting second assistant physician at the surgical department of Vänersborg hospital in 1932-1933, second assistant physician there in 1933-1936, acting district physician in Tierp’s district in 1936-1937, doctor in Öjebyn’s district in 1937, physician at Spenshult sanatorium in 1937-1938, acting district physician in Nybro and Söderköping’s districts for shorter periods in 1938, doctor and acting second assistant physician at the Stockholm epidemic hospital in 1938-1939, doctor at St. Sigfrid’s hospital in Växjö in 1940, and district physician in Eringsboda district from 1941 onward.
